div1.head: Memorandum from Valery Havard to the Adjutant General, August 24, 1901
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS
DEPARTMENT OF CUBA
OFFICE OF CHIEF SURGEON,
HAVANA.
Memorandum for the Adjutant General of the Department.

In accordance with Par.18, S.O.172, H.A.A.G.O.o.s.
Contract Surgeon James Carroll U. S. Army is authorized to
carry out the investigation therein prescribed at Las Animas
Hospital, Havana, and the Director of said hospital will afford
him all necessary facilities for the purpose.

V Havard
Major and Surgeon U. S. A.
Chief Surgeon.

I believe the above order in which Major Gorgas
and Dr. Carroll concur, is necessary to define status of Dr. Carroll
enable Las Animas to give him all possible facilities and better
fix responsability for results - that is in case of unpleasant
results. Las Animas can throw the responsability where it belongs.
that is, upon Carroll, and keep up its good character.

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Nal Govt. of Cuba
letters received --- re YF

CIVIL DIVISION
DEPARTMENT OF CUBA
Rec'd 8-26 1901.

Headquarters Department of Cuba,
Received AUG 25, 1901

Submits memorandum of
proposed order defining status
of Contract Surgeon James
Carroll, U. S. A. Authorizes
him to carry out investigations
prescribed in Par. 18, S.O.
172, A.G.O., at Las Animas
Hospital; the Director of said
hospital to furnish him the
necessary facilities there-
for.

3.--In accordance with paragraph 18, Special Orders No. 172, current
series, Headquarters of the Army, Contract Surgeon James Carroll,
U. S. Army, is authorized to carry out the investigation therein
prescribed at Las Animas Hospital in this city, and the Director of
said hospital will afford him all necessary facilities for the pur-
pose.
By command of Brigadier General Wood:
